content:
This is blowing my mind ðŸ¤¯

 

Did you know?
The Google PageRank algorithm takes its name from Larry Page, not from web "pages"!

 

In fact, the first iteration was tested on academic papers rather than web pages.

 

Of course it was a deliberate word play ðŸ˜….
Page and Brin intended to create a web search engine from the beginning.

 

But still, nice discovery to wrap up the week :)

 

Happy Friday everybody!

images.alt: Person speaking into a microphone; inset shows a PageRank diagram.

headline: Mind-Blowing Origin of Google's PageRank Name
description: Discover the quirky origin of Google's PageRank name and its academic roots. A fun fact to wrap up your week!
